title: How to Polish Your Furniture With Beer

steps.headline: Dip a soft cleaning cloth or a microfiber cloth into the stale beer.
steps.description: Wring to ensure that it is damp, not dripping wet.

steps.headline: Rub over the surface of wooden furniture.
steps.description: Rub until a shiny luster appears and the wood color deepens. It helps to use a dry cloth for the final polishing buff.

steps.headline: Add 1 quart beer, 1 tablespoon of sugar and 2 tablespoons of beeswax to a pan.
Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
Wipe the cooled mixture over the varnished oak wood furniture.
steps.description: Leave to dry, then polish with a soft cloth.

text: Steps Dip a soft cleaning cloth or a microfiber cloth into the stale beer. Wring to ensure that it is damp, not dripping wet. Rub over the surface of wooden furniture. Rub until a shiny luster appears and the wood color deepens. It helps to use a dry cloth for the final polishing buff. Beer and beeswax polish Add 1 quart beer, 1 tablespoon of sugar and 2 tablespoons of beeswax to a pan. Bring to the boil. Remove from the heat and allow to cool.  Wipe the cooled mixture over the varnished oak wood furniture. Leave to dry, then polish with a soft cloth.
